title: 29A Distro Sites
historical_context: This article is part of the 29A hacking groupâ€™s communication, highlighting their distribution sites and community engagement during the early days of virus development and distribution.
target_audience: Hackers, virus developers, and those interested in the early hacker culture.
short_summary: The article provides an overview of the 29A group's distribution sites for their virus binaries and encourages community interaction through IRC and email. It lists various websites and boards that distribute 29A's work.
summary: The piece reflects the collaborative spirit of the hacker community in the late 1990s, showcasing how groups like 29A relied on a network of websites and boards to disseminate their work. It highlights the importance of communication within the community, as members are encouraged to join the distribution efforts and maintain contact with the group. This article not only serves as a practical guide for those looking to engage with 29A but also captures the essence of the hacker culture at the time, where sharing knowledge and resources was paramount.
